CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 5-4;No separate issue under Art. 6-1
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON für PERSON ) ordered the applicant 's pre - trial detention on suspicion of attempted sexual coercion ( geschlechtliche GPE ) . The court based the suspicion against the applicant on the statement of the victim , who had identified the applicant in an identity parade . Further , it considered that , given the applicant 's criminal record , there was a risk that he might commit another offence similar to the one of which he was suspected ( GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , after a hearing held in the presence of the public prosecutor , the applicant and his defence counsel , ordered that the applicant 's pre - trial detention should continue . Referring to the testimony of the victim , it found that there was a reasonable suspicion against the applicant . Further , there was a risk that he might commit another offence similar to the CARDINAL of which he was suspected . The court stated that the applicant had CARDINAL previous convictions , mainly for property - related offences , but recently also for violent crimes . The court found that , in the light of the applicant 's recidivism and his character , the prolongation of his pre - trial detention was reasonable . The applicant appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) , sitting in private , dismissed the appeal and upheld ORG decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , after holding a hearing in the presence of the parties , dismissed an application for the applicant 's release and ordered the continuation of his pre - trial detention . The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged another application for release . He stressed that there were no reasons to maintain his pre - trial detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor 's office ( Staatsanwaltschaft ) filed the bill of indictment . The applicant appealed against it .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having held a hearing in the presence of the parties , ordered that the applicant 's pre - trial detention should continue .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision . He submitted that there was no reasonable suspicion against him as the testimony of the only witness for the prosecution had been contradictory .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting in private , dismissed the applicant 's appeal against the bill of indictment and the appeals against ORG decisions of DATE and DATE . It found that there was no doubt about the credibility of the witness and that there was therefore a reasonable suspicion against the applicant . Further , it upheld ORG repeated finding that reasons for detention on remand ( GPE ) existed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a fundamental rights complaint ( Grundrechtsbeschwerde ) with ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) against this decision . He submitted that there was no strong suspicion against him and that there were no reasons to maintain the detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting in private , dismissed the complaint . It found that there was no doubt about the credibility of the witness and that reasons for the applicant 's detention on remand subsisted .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , sitting with CARDINAL professional and CARDINAL lay judges , held a public hearing , convicted the applicant of attempted sexual coercion and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's plea of nullity .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed an appeal by the applicant , but allowed CARDINAL lodged by the public prosecutor and increased the term of imprisonment to DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( Strafprozeβordnung ) establishes a system of periodic hearings for the review of pre - trial detention , which are to be conducted proprio motu . The relevant part of Article CARDINAL provides as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Decisions ordering or continuing detention on remand and decisions of the court of second instance continuing detention on remand shall not be effective for longer than a certain period ; the date of expiry shall be given in the decision . Prior to the expiry of the period of detention a hearing regarding the detention shall be held or the accused shall be released .
CARDINAL . NORP The period of detention shall ,
( CARDINAL ) where detention on remand is ordered , be for DATE from the date on which the accused is arrested ;
( CARDINAL ) where the first decision is taken to continue detention on remand , be for DATE from the date of the decision ;
( CARDINAL ) where a further decision is taken to continue detention on remand , be for DATE from the date of the decision .

An accused who is held in pre - trial detention has to be assisted by counsel ( LAW ) . Copies of all documents relevant for assessing the suspicion or the reasons for the detention must be served on the prosecution and the defence free of charge before the first hearing ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW provides :

“ CARDINAL . The investigating judge shall conduct the hearing regarding the detention ; it is not open to the public . The accused , his counsel , the public prosecutor and the probation officer shall be informed of the date of the hearing .
CARDINAL . The accused shall be brought before the judge at the hearing , unless this is impossible because of illness . He shall be represented by counsel .
The court of appeal , when dealing with appeals against decisions of the investigating judge concerning pre - trial detention , takes its decision sitting in private pursuant to LAW .
